meanings.definition: To join closely and firmly, as pieces of wood, metal, or other material.
meanings.sent1: She was faying the two wooden planks together to make a sturdy table.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith was faying the metal pieces to create a strong bond.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter accidentally fayed his thumb to the table while working.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like faying two pieces of puzzle together, inseparable.
meanings.sent5: The glue faying the broken vase back together was barely visible.

meanings.definition: The surface of a piece of material that is in contact with another piece when they are joined together.
meanings.sent1: Make sure the faying of the two boards is smooth for a seamless finish.
meanings.sent2: Inspect the faying of the metal parts to ensure a proper fit.
meanings.sent3: The intricate design on the faying of the pottery added a unique touch.
meanings.sent4: The faying of the fabric created a beautiful pattern when stitched together.
meanings.sent5: The faying of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to separate them.
